task.Question: In Series 9, Episode 11 of Doctor Who, the Doctor is trapped inside an ever-shifting maze. What is this location called in the official script for the episode? Give the setting exactly as it appears in the first scene heading.

Annotator Metadata.Steps:
1. Search the web for “Doctor Who series 9 episode 11 official script”.
2. Click result on the BBC website.
3. Scroll through the PDF to read the script, noting that it takes place in a mechanical castle location.
4. Scroll back to the first scene heading to note the answer, THE CASTLE
Annotator Metadata.Tools:
1. Search engine
2. Web browser
3. PDF viewer

steps.content: In Series 9, Episode 11 of Doctor Who, the Doctor is trapped inside an ever-shifting maze. What is this location called in the official script for the episode? Give the setting exactly as it appears in the first scene heading.

steps.reasoning:
1. Perform a web search for "Doctor Who Series 9 Episode 11 script" to locate the official script or a reliable source that contains it.

2. If the script is found, check if it includes the first scene heading. Extract the setting name as it appears in that heading.

3. If the script is not found, perform a web search for a detailed episode summary or analysis that might mention the location.

4. If the location is mentioned in the summary or analysis, note it down. If not, search for video content related to the episode that might provide insights into the setting.

5. If a relevant video is found, use the VideoReader tool to access the video and check the subtitles for the first scene heading.

6. Compile the findings to determine the exact name of the location as it appears in the first scene heading.

1. Specific facts or figures GIVEN in the request: 
   - Series 9, Episode 11 of Doctor Who features the Doctor trapped inside an ever-shifting maze.

2. Facts that may need to be looked up and WHERE SPECIFICALLY they might be found: 
   - The official script for Doctor Who Series 9, Episode 11 to find the exact name of the location as it appears in the first scene heading. This can be found on script databases or fan sites dedicated to Doctor Who.

3. Facts that may need to be derived: 
   - None.

4. Facts that are recalled from memory, hunches, well-reasoned guesses, etc.: 
   - The episode is titled "Heaven Sent."

serp.title: [PDF] DW9 - EP 11 Heaven Sent BLUE 240815.fdx - BBC
serp.snippet: THE DOCTOR (cont'd). (V.O.). It moves slowly, but it never stops. Now: cutting round various different locations in this sprawling castle world.

serp.snippet: I am the Doctor. I'm coming to find you, and I will never, ever stop. Doctor Who Season 9 Episode 11. Heaven Sent

serp.title: Doctor Who Series 9 (2015) - BBC
serp.snippet: Episode 10 - Face The Raven (Shooting Script) by Sarah Dollard. Episode 10 - Face The Raven by Sarah Dollard. Episode 11 - Heaven Sent by Steven Moffat.

        11/28/15 16:16
    strong
      The Doctor
    
    emphasis
      (O.C.)
    : As you come into this world, something else is also born.
    emphasis
      ( Rumbling )
    You begin your life, and it begins a journey... towards you. It moves slowly, but it never stops. Wherever you go, whatever path you take, it will follow. Never faster, never slower, always coming. You will run. It will walk. You will rest. It will not. One day, you will linger in the same place too long. You will sit too still or sleep too deep... and when, too late, you rise to go... you will notice a second shadow next to yours. Your life will then be over.
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Teleport Chamber room ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    emphasis
      ( Gasping )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He coughs and gasps for air )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Flashback ]
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Raven caws )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      [ End Flashback ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      The Doctor
    : If you think because she is dead, I am weak, then you understand very little. If you were any part of k*lling her, and you're not afraid, then you understand nothing at all. So, for your own sake, understand this. I am the Doctor. I'm coming to find you, and I will never, ever stop.
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    Doctor Who
    LineBreak
    Season 9 Episode 11
    LineBreak
    strong
      Heaven Sent
    LineBreak
    Original air date: November 28, 2015
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Tower ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      The Doctor
    : The equipment in that room is consistent with an augmented ultra long-range teleport. So, I'm not more than a single light year from where I was, and I'm in the same time zone. When the sun sets, I'll be able to establish an exact position by the stars. Then you'll have a choice. Come out, show yourself, or keep on hiding. Clara said I shouldn't take revenge. You should know, I don't always listen.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Oh, what's this? Well, are you gardeners? I hate gardening! What sort of a person has a power complex about flowers? It's dictatorship for inadequates. Or to put it another way, it's dictatorship. Come on! Chop, chop! The Doctor will see you now! Show me what you've got! I just watched my best friend die in agony. My day can't get any worse. Let's see what we can do about yours!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Static hisses )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Loud thump )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Thumping footsteps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Footsteps get louder )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He groans )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : I know you. I've seen you before!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    I used to know a trick, back when I was young and telepathic. Clearly, you can't make an actual psychic link with a door, for one very obvious reason - they're notoriously cross. I mean, imagine life as a door. People keep pushing past you. All of that knocking, but it's never for you. And you get locked up every night, so if you're just a little bit nice...
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Lock clicks )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : See, Clara? Still got it. But I...
    emphasis
      ( He murmurs )
    Um... I can't actually see a way out of this... I've finally run out of corridor. There's a life summed up. Now, this is new. I'm scared. I just realised that I'm actually scared of dying.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Clang )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Silence )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Something I said? What did I say? Why did you stop?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Creaking )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Loud crashing and rumbling )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Bedroom ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    emphasis
      ( Springs creak )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Old. Very old.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Footsteps thump )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Possibly very, very old.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Fly buzzes )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : When I was a very little boy, there was an old lady who died. They covered her in veils, but it was a hot, sunny day, and the flies came. It gave me nightmares for years. So, who's been stealing my nightmares? What am I here for? You've known about me for a very long time, right?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    So, what is it? Is it a trap? Is it a prison? No! Is it a t*rture chamber? Am I right? Somebody really should know better. Anyone who can put all of this together and steal my bad dreams, they should know better.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    The secrets I have - no chance. No telling, not me. I told you I was scared of dying. And I wasn't lying either. Advantage - me! Because you won't see
    emphasis
      this
    coming!
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ INT. TARDIS ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Sorry, I'm late! Jumped out of a window. Certain death. Don't you want to know how I survived? Go on. Ask me! No, of course I had to jump! The first rule of being interrogated is that you are the only irreplaceable person in the t*rture chamber. The room is yours, so work it
    BID:384 link ., url='http://transcripts.foreverdreaming.org/viewtopic.php?f=53&t=24027'
    If they're going to thr*aten you with death, show them who's boss. Die faster! You've seen me do that more often than most. Isn't that right, Clara?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Rule one of dying - don't. Rule two - slow down. You've got the rest of your life. The faster you think, the slower it will pass.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Concentrate! Assume you're going to survive. Always assume that. Imagine you've already survived. There's a storm room in your mind. Lock the door and think! This is my storm room. I always imagine that I'm back in my Tardis, showing off, telling you how I escaped, making you laugh. That's what I'm doing right now. I am falling, Clara. I'm dying. And I'm going to explain to you how I survived.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    I can't wait to hear what I say. I'm nothing without an audience.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Booming )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : One hope - salt! Thought I smelled it earlier. When I broke the window, I was sure. Salty air. This castle is standing in the sea. Diving into water from a great height is no guarantee of survival. I need to know exactly how far I'm going to fall, and how fast. Why do you think I threw the stool? Fall time to impact...
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Distant splash )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    
    emphasis
      (O.C.)
    : .. seven seconds.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Because you won't see this coming! The wind resistance of the stool, the atmospheric density... the strength of the local gravity. Am I spoiling the magic? I work at this stuff, you know? Should hit the water in about... 0.02 seconds. The chances of remaining conscious are...
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Loud splash )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps on chalkboard )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Can't I just sleep?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Do I have to know everything?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Clara, I can't always...
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Echoing screeches )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He breathes deeply )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Boots squelch )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Breathing )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Storeroom ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      The Doctor
    : It keeps coming, Clara. Wherever I go, it follows. Why? Why does it do that?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Always the teacher. What's the right question, then?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Tapping )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : It's following me. Wherever I go, it's tracking me. Slowly though. Scary lurching.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Scary!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    These screens everywhere... It's showing me exactly where it is all the time, how far it's got, how near.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Because it's trying to scare me! Putting its breath on my neck. That's the point! That's what it's doing. This is theatre! It's all about fear. Working hypothesis - I'm in a fully automated haunted house. A mechanical maze.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Clattering )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : It's a k*ller puzzle box designed to scare me to death, and I'm trapped inside it.
    emphasis
      ( chuckles )
    Must be Christmas!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Door thuds and creaks open )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Dripping )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Door creaks open )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Grounds ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    emphasis
      ( Door slams )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Faint bells chime )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Another spade? Someone wants me to dig. What do you think, Clara? Is someone trying to give me a hint? What would you do?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Yes. Yes, of course you would. Which, let's be honest, is what k*lled you. So, someone is trying to tell me that there's something important buried in this garden. That's almost the first thing they tried to tell me. Could be a trick. Could be one of my predecessors. Because I'm not the first prisoner here, am I?! All those skulls! Wonder where they all went wrong. Building this height, creature that slow, so what...?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    An hour.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He breathes heavily and pants )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Fly buzzes )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Creature screeches )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He pants )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Thudding, he grunts )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Rumbling )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He pants )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Physics of a triangle. You lose!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Footsteps thump )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : So? It can set traps. That's OK. I'm good at traps.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    So, where are you off to?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Only one way in and one way out. Well, seeing as you're going...
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( The Doctor digs )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : No, no. That's not right.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Crickets chirp )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      CLUNK!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Scrapes ground )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Screeching, The Doctor yells )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ INT. TARDIS ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Well, that was another close one. Or it will have been, once I've been and gone and got myself out of it. So, how am I going to do that? Come on, teacher, ask me questions!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : I'm actually scared of dying.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Chalk taps )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : The truth, yes. But not any old truth, Clara. This whole place is designed to terrify me. I'm being interrogated. It's not just truth it wants. That's not enough. It's confession. I have to tell truths I've never told before. That's the only thing that stops it.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    You see, the problem is... Clara... there are truths that I can never tell. Not for anything. But I'm scared and I'm alone. Alone... and very, very scared.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    I confess.
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Grounds ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    I didn't leave Gallifrey because I was bored! That was a lie! It's always been a lie!
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    Not enough? You want more?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    I was scared! I ran because I was scared! Is that what you want me to say? Is that true enough for you?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Creaking )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Quiet snarling )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Wind howls )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Masonry rumbles )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Loud rumbling )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Clanking )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Bedroom ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    emphasis
      ( Clock ticks )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    :
    emphasis
      It's funny, the day you lose someone isn't the worst. At least you've got something to do. It's all the days they stay dead.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Flies buzz )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : 57 minutes.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    This is how my world works, Clara. I tick off the seconds as they pass.
    emphasis
      ( Door thuds )
    My life is a countdown. If I draw the creature to one extreme of the castle, and I run to the other extreme, I can earn myself a maximum of 82 minutes.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    82 minutes to eat, sleep and work. My work is finding Room 12. The castle wants me to. It's luring me.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    The numbering is a bit confused, as if the rooms are all jumbled up. Maybe they move around.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    I saw the whole castle move... when I made the creature stop.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( He sighs )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Every room, if I leave it long enough, reverts to its condition at the moment I arrive. It tidies up after itself. Automated room service.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    I think this whole place is inside a closed energy loop, constantly recycling. Or maybe I'm in Hell? That's OK. I'm not scared of Hell. It's just Heaven for bad people. But how long will I have to be here?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Food trickles off spoon )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Forever?
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Distorted clattering )
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      The Doctor
    : It's always coming.
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    emphasis
      ( Footsteps thud )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : Always closer. The countdown never stops. But the countdown to what?
    LineBreak
    insertion
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    strong
      [ Teleport Chamber room ]
    LineBreak
    separator, orientation='horizontal'
    emphasis
      ( Door opens )
    LineBreak
    LineBreak
    strong
      The Doctor
    : There are two events in everybody's life that nobody remembers, two moments experienced by every living thing. Yet, no-one remembers anything about them. steps.reasoning: The transcript indicates that the Doctor is in a 'Teleport Chamber room' at the beginning of the episode. This is likely the setting referred to in the first scene heading.

steps.overview: Extracted the location name from the transcript of Doctor Who Series 9, Episode 11.
steps.long_answer: The location where the Doctor is trapped at the beginning of Series 9, Episode 11 of Doctor Who is called 'Teleport Chamber room' as per the official script.
